description: The site of this ancient settlement, which provides evidence for habitation from the Bronze Age into late antiquity, lies just to the north of the modern settlement that has inherited its name (Kabile) in the Bulgarian province of Yambol.
details: A.G. Poulter (1983 and BAtlas) associates the name "Diospolis", transmitted in the 6th-century Synecdemus of Hierocles, with the same site as Kabyle. Still, some other scholars are not convinced (e.g., von Bredow in New Pauly).

properties.description: Representative location based on OpenStreetMap. Chronology following Barrington Atlas, PECS, New Pauly.
properties.title: OSM location of Kabile
